forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Rain Showers then Mostly Clear
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers before 11pm. Mostly clear. Low around 44, with temperatures rising to around 46 overnight. Northwest wind 10 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny, with a high near 57. Northwest wind 5 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
As darkness envelops Downtown San Francisco, a hint of moisture lingers in the air, whispering of the slight chance of rain showers that may dance lightly before the evening ends. The sky, mostly clear now, offers a serene backdrop as temperatures gently rise, ushering in an evening that feels almost crisp. The cool northwest wind, brisk yet refreshing, carries the faint sound of city life, enhancing the ambiance of the moment. There is no fog to obscure the view tonight, and the absence of the marine layer allows for a rare clarity in the air, offering slivers of brightness against the encroaching night.

As we transition into Tuesday, the forecast paints a promising day bathed in sunlight, with the temperatures reaching a comfortable high. The pleasant weather encourages simple pursuits—a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero, perhaps a visit to one of the cozy cafés that line the streets, where you can enjoy a warm beverage and watch the world pass by. Light layers would serve you well as the day's warmth will balance nicely with the cool evening air. So, embrace the charm of this city, relish the clarity of the skies, and savor the quiet beauty that a San Francisco night can offer.
